scoring_rule: Each problem: ALL words must be correct. Level: 80% of problems must pass.

problems.prompt:
# Syllable Puzzle

Find 9 words using the syllables from the bank.
Each syllable is used exactly once (extras are distractors).

## Syllable Bank
husky, ati, fi, hold, en, kenya, low, truf, tonin, lots, boss, back, pi, shrugs, ups, ancee, al, wilt

## Clues
A. (2 syllables) — SYN: accompaniment
B. (2 syllables) — SYN: admit
C. (2 syllables) — SYN: airplane pilot
D. (1 syllables) — SYN: Bos
E. (1 syllables) — SYN: shrug
F. (2 syllables) — A brand of car (automobile) originating in Australia.
G. (2 syllables) — SYN: bride-to-be
H. (1 syllables) — SYN: droop
I. (1 syllables) — SYN: Eskimo dog

## Answer Format
Return JSON: {"answers": ["WORD1", "WORD2", ...]}
Words must be UPPERCASE and in clue order.

# Syllable Puzzle

Find 10 words using the syllables from the bank.
Each syllable is used exactly once (extras are distractors).

## Syllable Bank
gle, lay, ta, gust, sanchez, de, ation, bate, iff, slice, frag, jin, tanooga, tar, peng, dis, brook, de, men, tion

## Clues
A. (2 syllables) — act later than planned, scheduled, or required
B. (1 syllables) — A salver, platter, or tray.
C. (2 syllables) — An informal and spirited but generally civil discussion of opposing views.
D. (1 syllables) — Of the highest quality; excellent; splendid.
E. (1 syllables) — A water meadow.
F. (1 syllables) — Venezuelan master terrorist raised by a Marxist-Leninist father; trained and worked with many terrorist groups (born in 1949)
G. (4 syllables) — A form of asexual reproduction or cloning where an organism splits into one or more pieces. Those pieces then become new individuals.
H. (2 syllables) — cause aversion in; offend the moral sense of
I. (2 syllables) — To make a noise of metal or glass clattering against itself.
J. (2 syllables) — charge a [masked]

## Answer Format
Return JSON: {"answers": ["WORD1", "WORD2", ...]}
Words must be UPPERCASE and in clue order.

# Syllable Puzzle

Find 10 words using the syllables from the bank.

## Clues
A. (2 syllables) — Structure hint: (prefix: co-, suffix: -ed) — transfer to another

C. (1 syllables) — Structure hint: (prefix: re-) — female ruff
D. (4 syllables) — permanence by virtue of the power to resist stress or force

Return JSON: {"answers": ["WORD1", "WORD2", ...]}
Words must be UPPERCASE and in clue order.

# Syllable Puzzle

Find 11 words using the syllables from the bank.
Each syllable is used exactly once (extras are distractors).

## Syllable Bank
whim, cadet, low, cram, mod, yel, redi, bloom, ty, elled, streak, pers, ed, rect, ing, den, hamp, ton, ton, gents, news, si, pa, bridges

## Clues
A. (2 syllables) — United States musician who was the first to use the vibraphone as a jazz instrument (1913-2002)
B. (3 syllables) — Stupidity; denseness.
C. (3 syllables) — a daily or weekly publication on folded sheets; contains news and articles and advertisements
D. (1 syllables) — a denture anchored to teeth on either side of missing teeth
E. (3 syllables) — channel into a new direction
F. (2 syllables) — Far East Asian .
G. (3 syllables) — a university town in south central Indiana
H. (1 syllables) — The color of the powder of a mineral. So called, because a simple field test for a mineral is to [masked] it against unglazed white porcelain.
I. (1 syllables) — a military trainee (as at a military academy)
J. (1 syllables) — informal abbreviation of `gentleman'
K. (2 syllables) — create a representation or model of

## Answer Format
Return JSON: {"answers": ["WORD1", "WORD2", ...]}
Words must be UPPERCASE and in clue order.
